channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned vehicle?, 19th August
item.description:
This car is parked in the bays in Veroan Rd, near the junction with Basilon Road. The front passenger tyre is completely flat and there's a huge hole in it because someone has shoved a soft drink bottle in it. Parking in the bays is at a premium so this vehicle is taking up vital space. Not sure how long it's been there, certainly since Monday 18th August

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Veroan Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged road and footpath, 19th August
item.description:
Part of the footpath infront of my house was repaired few years back with tarmac . This has now sunk and causing a trip hazard for my grand children when they visit . One of my grandchildren tripped yesterday and grazed her knee and should not stop crying . The road outside my house is side by the public to turn around , causing the upper surface to deteriorate with lots of loose grit which creates a horrible noise when people turn their cars around there. This has also caused pot hole in the centre of the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bright Close, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of rubbished stuffed behind an electricity box, 19th August
item.description:
Someone’s stuffed lots of rubbish in the tight space between an electricity circuit box and the buildings in Phase 3 Dalston Square. The location is next to the buses on the bus depot at Dalston Junction. Map pin is correct. Please can someone clean this.

item.title: Now the padlocks on the tree are two, Could please do something?, 19th August
item.description:
Hi, I don’t know what you are waiting for to remove the padlock on the tree; you waited so long that now there are two padlocks and no one anymore. They are damaging the tree with those locks, and I don’t see any interest in protecting this tree.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Marks Rise, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
